page.title: 08FARMING SLOUGH FARM
page.content:
FARMING{SLOUGH FARM}
Slough Farm is thought to be{ {Elizabethan.}It covers 100 acres which are used for grazing and hay.The farm buildings consist mainly of sties and stables.The farmer who is a tenant and his family run the farm. There are 200{Large White Landrace} pigs,40-50 horses stabled for their owners who ride them,2{Jersey}cows and 7{Friesians.}The Friesians are sold at 7 months for their meat. There are 60 sows.The piglets are born at any time of the year.The average litter is ten.The sows are fed on mixed barley with vitamins and fish meal.The pigs put on 10-15lbs in a week,deepending on age.When they are sold they weigh about 70lbs. The machinery includes two tractors, a muck spreader and a barley mixer.
